result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

UNSIGNED
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements.

3:01 PM Defendant Wendell Dean Anderson appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney George Andrew Limbeck in court for Wendell Dean Anderson.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Limbeck informs the Court not proceeding to a prelim today but forgot to do a signed waiver of prelim and at last hearing it was indicated today's hearing would be a waiver. Court does colloquy w/deft on the record. Probable Cause Found, Defendant bound over.
Information filed/reading waived, Not guilty plea entered all Counts.  State will email and e-file information/counts that mirror criminal complaint, defense waives a formal reading. NC pleas entered by the Court. Atty Limbeck's bond motion addressed. State goes through deft's criminal history and objects to any bond modification, global offer in case for prison. It was determined no bond ever set in this case, both parties agree a bond should be set, defense reqeusts $1,000 cash and state requests $5,000 cash/case22CF432 currently has a $10,000 cash bond. Court sets bond at $1,000.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
to Modify Bond -defense

8:35 AM Defendant Wendell Dean Anderson appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney George Andrew Limbeck in court for Wendell Dean Anderson.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. No identified victims. Atty Limbeck has had one meeting w/defendant and was planning to waive the prelim.  Atty Limbeck was unable to go back and talk to the deft and complete the waiver.  Defense would also like to file a bond motion. Atty Limbeck requests a brief adjournment. Witness is present on the conference line. Court finds good cause to waive time limits. Defendant has a Door County case and would like to globalize here.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
